lines.content: * The primary Duke class. Contains the main function to run the Duke chatbot Bob.

* Creates a new Duke chatbot object.

* Represents an exception that happens when an invalid input is entered into the program.
* Creates the DukeException with the given message msg.
* @param msg The exception message for the DukeException.
* Represents a parser to process commands entered into the chatbot and returns the corresponding Command.
* Parses the message to be processed into a Command, then returns that Command.
* @param message The message to be parsed.
* @return The Command parsed from the given message.
* @throws DukeException If there is an invalid input message causing an error in parsing.
public static Command parse(String message) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("You need to specify the index of the task to mark.");
throw new DukeException("The index of the task to mark is not a valid integer.");
throw new DukeException("You need to specify the index of the task to unmark.");
throw new DukeException("The index of the task to unmark is not a valid integer.");
throw new DukeException("You need to specify the keyword to find the tasks.");
throw new DukeException("You need to specify the index of the task to delete.");
throw new DukeException("The index of the task to delete is not a valid integer.");
throw new DukeException("The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("A deadline requires exactly 1 due date.");
throw new DukeException("The description of an event cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("An event requires exactly 2 from/to dates.");
throw new DukeException("I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Represents a file storage where all tasks will be saved into and retrieved from when the chatbot is run.

public void processLine(String line, TaskList tasks) {

* @return TaskList containing all valid tasks processed from the file; else empty TaskList if any error in reading

* Saves all tasks in the chatbot into the file in the hard disk.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be saved into the file.
* Represents a user interface for the user to input their commands and the bot to reply a message.
* Prints a welcome message to the user.
+ "\t What can I do for you?\n"
* Prints a line containing a divider.
* Reads the next line from the specified Scanner.
* @param sc The scanner to read the next line from.
* @return The next line read from the Scanner, as a String.
* Prints an error message, formatted for the chatbot.
* @param errorMsg The error message to be printed.
* Prints a message, formatted for the chatbot.
* @param message The message to be printed.
* Represents a command to add tasks (todos, deadlines, and events) into the task list.
* Constructor for the AddCommand for todos.
* @param message The description for the to-do in the to-do list.
* Constructor for the AddCommand for deadlines.
* @param message The description for the deadline in the to-do list.
* @param deadline The deadline as a String in the format yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.
* Constructor for the AddCommand for events.
* @param message The description for the event in the to-do list.
* @param from The starting date for the event as a String in the format yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.
* @param to The ending date for the event as a String in the format yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.
public AddCommand(String message, String from, String to) {
* Executes the given AddCommand using the specified TaskList, Ui and Storage.
* @param tasks The task list to run the command on.
* @param ui The UI to print any output onto.
* @param storage The storage to save tasks to.
* @throws DukeException If task type is invalid; or date Strings cannot be parsed (for deadlines and events).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("Task type is invalid!");
// break not needed as exception is thrown
ui.print("Got it. I've added this task:");
ui.print("Now you have " + tasks.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");
throw new DukeException("Dates should be formatted yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss,\n"
* Gets the command type for the specific AddCommand.
* @return "Add Todo" if AddCommand adds a to-do; "Add Deadline" if AddCommand adds a deadline;
*         "Add Event" if AddCommand adds an event; "Add " otherwise.
* Represents a specific command to be executed.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException;
* Returns whether the Command should exit the program when run.
* Represents a command to delete tasks from the task list.
* @param index The index in the task list to delete.
* Executes the given DeleteCommand using the specified TaskList, Ui and Storage.
* @param tasks The task list to delete a task on.
* @param ui The UI to print any output onto.
* @param storage The storage to save and update tasks.
* @throws DukeException If index is out of range for the task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
ui.print("Now you have " + tasks.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");
throw new DukeException("Cannot delete a task that is out of range!");
* Gets the command type for the DeleteCommand.
* Represents a command to quit the chatbot program.
* Executes the given ExitCommand using the specified TaskList, Ui and Storage.
* @param tasks The task list to run the command on (if needed).
* @param ui The UI to print any output onto.
* @param storage The storage to save and update tasks (if needed).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.print("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Returns whether the ExitCommand should exit the program when run, which is true.

public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

ui.print("There are no tasks with the given keyword!");
* Gets the command type for the FindCommand.

* Gets the command type for the ListCommand.

* Executes the given MarkCommand using the specified TaskList, Ui and Storage.

public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
ui.print("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
throw new DukeException("Cannot mark a task that is out of range!");
* Gets the command type for the MarkCommand.
* Represents a command to mark tasks as not completed in the task list.
* @param index The index in the task list to unmark.

* @param tasks The task list to unmark a task in.

* @param storage The storage to save and update tasks.
* @throws DukeException If index is out of range for the task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {

throw new DukeException("Cannot unmark a task that is out of range!");

* Represents a deadline task, containing a description and a deadline.
* Returns a new Deadline task containing the message and the deadline date.

* Returns a String containing information within the Deadline task, formatted to be saved.
* @return The deadline, formatted as a String to be saved in the save file.
* Returns a String representation of the Deadline task, formatted for output in the application.
* @return The deadline, formatted as a String for output in the application.
* Represents an event task, containing a description, from date and to date.
* Returns a new Event task containing the message and the from and to dates.
* @param message The description for the Event.
* @param from The starting date of the Event.
* @param to The ending date of the Event.
public Event(String message, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {

* Returns the number of tasks in the TaskList.

* @return The ArrayList containing all the save-file String representation of the Tasks within the TaskList.
* Marks a Task with a specified index as done.

* Finds all tasks with description containing the search string, and returns the list of tasks as a TaskList.
* @param findStr The search string to search for the tasks.

* Represents a todo task, containing a description.

assertEquals("I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("An event requires exactly 2 from/to dates.", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("The description of an event cannot be empty.", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("A deadline requires exactly 1 due date.", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("The description of a deadline cannot be empty.", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("The description of a todo cannot be empty.", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("You need to specify the index of the task to mark.", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("The index of the task to mark is not a valid integer.", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("You need to specify the index of the task to unmark.", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("The index of the task to unmark is not a valid integer.", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("You need to specify the index of the task to delete.", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("The index of the task to delete is not a valid integer.", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("[E][ ] Message (from: Oct 10 2023, 12:15:00 to: Oct 11 2023, 13:30:45)", e.toString());
assertEquals("[E][X] Message (from: Oct 10 2023, 12:15:00 to: Oct 11 2023, 13:30:45)", e.toString());
